@logging_to_appins
def validate_parameters(storage_acc, raw_container, raw_source_folder, raw_name, standardised_container, standardised_source_folder, standardised_name, linked_service, sheet_name=0, header_row=0):
    
    ''' 
    Type check the parameters that will be used in the ETL processing with pyspark in subsequent functions    
     '''
    
    ### imports
    from notebookutils import mssparkutils
    import logging
    
    ### creating filepath
    filepath = raw_container + raw_source_folder + raw_name

    ### checking abfss path
    if filepath.split('abfss://')[0] != '':
        raise ValueError("File path string is not of abfss:// type")
        mssparkutils.notebook.exit()
    
    ### checking filepath has xlsx file in it 

    ### checking str data types
    # defining parameters to check
    parameters = {
        'filepath':filepath,
        'storage_acc':storage_acc,
        'linked_service':linked_service
    }

    # checking str type
    str_errors = ''
    for para in parameters:
        if type(parameters[para]) != str:
            str_errors += parameters[para]
        if str_errors != '':
            raise TypeError(f"Parameters: {str_errors} not of type string") 
            mssparkutils.notebook.exit()

    # checking sheet name type is str or int
    if type(sheet_name) != str and type(sheet_name) != int:
        raise TypeError("Sheet name should either be a string or a integer")
        mssparkutils.notebook.exit()

    # checking int type
    if type(sheet_name) != int:
        raise TypeError("Header row should be an integer value")
        mssparkutils.notebook.exit()

def _cleanse_headers(df):
    '''
    NOT A PURE FUNCTION
    Take a dataframe and appropriately cleanse headers in a file
    '''
    ### imports
    import pandas as pd
    import re

    ### type checks
    if isinstance(df, pd.DataFrame):
        raise TypeError("Expecting a pandas dataframe")
        mssparkutils.notebook.exit()

    cols = df.columns
    cols=[re.sub("( |\#|\# |\.|\(|\)|\/)","_",i) for i in cols] # replace chars with _
    cols=[re.sub("([\_]{2,})","_",i) for i in cols] #replace consecutive _ with one _
    cols=[re.sub("(\_)$","",i) for i in cols] #remove trailing _
    cols = [item.replace(',','') for item in cols]
    df.columns = cols

    return df 

def _change_types(df):
    '''
    NOT A PURE FUNCTION
    Take a dataframe and appropriately make all data types a string
    '''

    ### imports
    import pandas as pd
    
    ### type checks
    if isinstance(df, pd.DataFrame):
        raise TypeError("Expecting a pandas dataframe")
        mssparkutils.notebook.exit()

    return df.astype(str, errors='ignore')

@logging_to_appins
def ingest_excel_to_parquet(storage_acc, raw_container, raw_source_folder, raw_name, standardised_container, standardised_source_folder, standardised_name, linked_service, sheet_name=0, header=0):

    '''
    Create a parquet file with delta capabilities from a source excel file
    '''

    ### initialising spark session
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()

    ### setting appopriate spark variables
    source_full_storage_account_name = storage_acc
    spark.conf.set(f"spark.storage.synapse.{source_full_storage_account_name}.linkedServiceName", linked_service )
    spark.conf.set(f"fs.azure.account.oauth.provider.type.{source_full_storage_account_name}", "com.microsoft.azure.synapse.tokenlibrary.LinkedServiceBasedTokenProvider")

    ### creating targetpath variable
    filepath = raw_container + raw_source_folder + raw_name
    targetpath = standardised_container + standardised_source_folder + standardised_name

    ### reading file with abfss file location format
    import pandas as pd
    df = pd.read_excel(filepath, sheet_name=sheet_name, header=header, dtype='object')
    
    ### cleanse headers 
    df = _cleanse_headers(df)
    
    ### change all types to string
    df = _change_types(df)

    ### writing output
    df.to_parquet(targetpath,allow_truncated_timestamps=True)

@logging_to_appins
def enable_delta_on_parquet(standardised_container, standardised_source_folder):
    '''
    Take a standard parquet file and enable delta lake capabiltiies on the file
    '''

    ### initialise spark session
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()
    spark.conf.set('spark.hadoop.orc.overwrite.output.file','true')

    ### create target delta folder variable
    target_delta_folder = standardised_container + standardised_source_folder

    ### check parquet file in targetpath exists
    ### OUTSTANDING

    ### converting parquet to delta table
    from delta.tables import DeltaTable
    if not DeltaTable.isDeltaTable(spark,target_delta_folder):
        deltaTable = DeltaTable.convertToDelta(spark, f"parquet.`{target_delta_folder}`")

@logging_to_appins
def lakedb_table_sparksql(db_name,delta_lake_table_name,standardised_container, standardised_source_folder):
    '''
    Make delta parquet file available in lake database
    '''

    ### imports and spark session creation
    from pyspark.sql import SparkSession
    from delta.tables import DeltaTable
    spark = SparkSession.builder.getOrCreate()

    ### create target delta folder variable
    target_delta_folder = standardised_container + standardised_source_folder

    ### check parquet file is now delta table
    ### outstanding

    ### make delta table available to be queried in spark sql
    spark.sql(f"drop table if exists {db_name}.{delta_lake_table_name};")
    spark.sql(f"CREATE TABLE {db_name}.{delta_lake_table_name} USING DELTA LOCATION '{target_delta_folder}'")
